summary: Hopes of an early resolution to the US-India tariff imbroglio receded materially this week. President Trump’s out-of-the-blue decision to double tariffs on India, had India hardening its stance on continuing with its Russia trade and not giving in to demands to open up its...
fullContent: Hopes of an early resolution to the US-India tariff imbroglio receded materially this week. President Trump’s out-of-the-blue decision to double tariffs on India, had India hardening its stance on continuing with its Russia trade and not giving in to demands to open up its farm sector to US imports. With India, China and Russia displaying new interest in renewing their ties, Indian investors may need to brace for tariff uncertainties to last for a while. While the swathe of sectors covered by Trump’s 50% tariff is limited to a few sectors currently (engineering, jewellery, auto components, chemicals and textiles), investors need to budget for the possibility that they get extended to exempted sectors such as pharmaceuticals and electronics, if this fracas continues. Therefore, while forecasters are pegging India’s GDP estimates down by only 50-70 basis points as a result of this escalation, it does reduce choices for equity investors in an already expensive market.

fullContent: NSDL’s 62.5% surge in three days post-listing has handed massive gains to early institutional investors, with SBI, IDBI Bank and SUUTI each bagging a 650-bagger. Issued at Rs 800, the stock hit Rs 1,300.30 by August 8. SBI emerged the top gainer, turning a Rs 1.20 crore investment into Rs 7,801.80 crore with a 6,50,050% return.

title: Pick of BL commodities - August 10, 2025
summary: Last week, chaos reigned in the global gold market as the US Customs said the import of one-kg gold bars into the US would attract 39% tariffs. The one-kg gold bars are the bread and butter of the Comex trade. Gold prices on Comex hit a fresh high of $3,545 an ounce.
fullContent: Last week, chaos reigned in the global gold market as the US Customs said the import of one-kg gold bars into the US would attract 39% tariffs. The one-kg gold bars are the bread and butter of the Comex trade. Gold prices on Comex hit a fresh high of $3,545 an ounce. There is a conundrum over the Nendran banana chips business, as coconut oil prices have soared and Nendran banana prices have crashed. Meanwhile, prices of coconut oil and copra declined. Farmers have covered at least 85% of the normal area under kharif sowing, as the South-West monsoon showered surplus rains. The area under cotton is likely to be lower this year as farmers in Gujarat have shifted to groundnut and soyabean.

title: David Sacks is correct
summary: A BEST CASE SCENARIO FOR AI? The Doomer narratives were wrong. Predicated on a “rapid take-off” to AGI, they predicted that the leading AI model would use its intelligence to self-improve, leaving others in the dust, and quickly achieving a godlike superintelligence.
fullContent: A BEST CASE SCENARIO FOR AI? The Doomer narratives were wrong. Predicated on a “rapid take-off” to AGI, they predicted that the leading AI model would use its intelligence to self-improve, leaving others in the dust, and quickly achieving a godlike superintelligence. title: Olectra Greentech Q1 Results: PAT rises 7% YoY to Rs 26 crore, revenue surges nearly 11%
summary: Olectra Greentech posted a 7.3% YoY rise in Q1FY26 net profit to Rs 26.03 crore, driven by a 10.6% jump in revenue from operations. Segment-wise, the Insulator Division surged 46.5% and the E-vehicle Division grew 5.7%. Shares have gained 24.82% in three months but fell 2.
fullContent: Olectra Greentech posted a 7.3% YoY rise in Q1FY26 net profit to Rs 26.03 crore, driven by a 10.6% jump in revenue from operations. Segment-wise, the Insulator Division surged 46.5% and the E-vehicle Division grew 5.7%. Shares have gained 24.82% in three months but fell 2.7% on Friday to Rs 1,410.50.
